consolDepositBalance.description: This field displays the total amount of unapplied deposits for the customer-subcustomer hierarchy this customer is a member of.Deposits are recorded in the general ledger, as a liability, when the customer makes an advance payment before delivery of goods or services. A deposit balance exists until the goods or services are delivered. Deposits do not affect the customer's accounts receivable balance.
consolDepositBalance.name: consolDepositBalance

consolOverdueBalance.description: This field shows the consolidated total owed for open transactions for this customer-subcustomer hierarchy that are past their due date based on the invoice terms.Note: For open transactions that do not have a due date, the transaction date is used as the due date to calculate this total.
consolOverdueBalance.name: consolOverdueBalance

consolUnbilledOrders.description: This field displays the total amount of orders that have been entered but not yet billed for the customer-subcustomer hierarchy this customer is a part of. If you have enabled the preference Customer Credit Limit Includes Orders, then this total is included in credit limit calculations. Set this preference at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Set Up Accounting > General.
consolUnbilledOrders.name: consolUnbilledOrders

emailTransactions.description: Set a preferred transaction delivery method for this customer. Choose to send transactions by regular mail, by email, by fax, or by a combination of the three. Then, when you select the customer on a transaction, their preferred delivery method is marked by default.    * Email – Check this box to check the To Be Emailed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.    * Print – Check this box to check the To Be Printed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.    * Fax – Check this box to check the To Be Faxed box by default on transactions when this customer is selected.Once you enter these settings on the customer record, these boxes are checked by default for transactions created from the customer record or for transactions that are copied or converted.Note: These settings override any customized settings on transaction forms you use.There are also preferences to set default values for new customer records at Setup > Company > Preferences > Printing, Fax,& Email Preferences. On the Print subtab, Fax subtab, or Email subtab, check Customers Default to [Print/Fax/Email] Transactions.You can also set these fields using the Mass Update function. Go to Lists > Mass Updates > Mass Updates > General and click Customer.
emailTransactions.name: emailTransactions

globalSubscriptionStatus.value.description: Email recipients can have one of four subscription statuses:    * Confirmed Opt-In - When an email recipient has indicated that they want to receive your campaign and bulk merge email, they are assigned this subscription status. Only a recipient can set his or her subscription status to Confirmed Opt-In.    * Soft Opt-In - Recipients with this status can receive opt-in messages that enable them to confirm whether or not they want to receive your email campaigns as well as bulk email.      You can set a recipient’s status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.    * Soft Opt-Out - Recipients with this status cannot receive campaign or bulk email messages but can receive opt-in messages.      You can change this subscription status to Soft Opt-In manually or through a mass update.    * Confirmed Opt-Out - Only the recipient can set their subscription status to Confirmed Opt-Out.      Recipients with this status cannot receive email campaigns, bulk email, or opt-in messages. Recipients with this status can only opt in again through the Customer Center or by clicking the link in an email message they have received prior to opting out.
globalSubscriptionStatus.value.name: globalSubscriptionStatus.value

receivablesAccount.internalId.description: Choose the A/R account to use by default on receivables transactions for this customer.If you select Use System Preference, the account selected at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Accounting Preferences > Items/Transactions in the Default Receivables Account field is used as this customer's default.
receivablesAccount.internalId.name: receivablesAccount.internalId

receivablesAccount.name.description: Choose the A/R account to use by default on receivables transactions for this customer.If you select Use System Preference, the account selected at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Accounting Preferences > Items/Transactions in the Default Receivables Account field is used as this customer's default.
receivablesAccount.name.name: receivablesAccount.name

referrer.description: Read-only field that returns the site that referred the customer to the NetSuite account website.
referrer.name: referrer

reminderDays.description: Sets the number of days before the end date that a reminder should be sent for renewing a customer's contract or project.
reminderDays.name: reminderDays

representingSubsidiary.externalId.description: Indicates that this entity is an intercompany customer. Select the subsidiary this customer represents as a buyer in intercompany transactions.
representingSubsidiary.externalId.name: representingSubsidiary.externalId

representingSubsidiary.internalId.description: Indicates that this entity is an intercompany customer. Select the subsidiary this customer represents as a buyer in intercompany transactions.
representingSubsidiary.internalId.name: representingSubsidiary.internalId

representingSubsidiary.name.description: Indicates that this entity is an intercompany customer. Select the subsidiary this customer represents as a buyer in intercompany transactions.
representingSubsidiary.name.name: representingSubsidiary.name

requirePwdChange.displayName: Require Password Change On Next Login
requirePwdChange.name: requirePwdChange

resaleNumber.description: Customer's  tax license number for cases where you do not collect sales tax from this customer because the merchandise will be resold.
resaleNumber.name: resaleNumber

salesGroup.externalId.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
salesGroup.externalId.name: salesGroup.externalId

salesGroup.internalId.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
salesGroup.internalId.name: salesGroup.internalId

salesGroup.name.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
salesGroup.name.name: salesGroup.name

salesReadiness.externalId.description: Choose how close the prospect or customer is to purchasing. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.
salesReadiness.externalId.name: salesReadiness.externalId

salesReadiness.internalId.description: Choose how close the prospect or customer is to purchasing. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.
salesReadiness.internalId.name: salesReadiness.internalId

salesReadiness.name.description: Choose how close the prospect or customer is to purchasing. You can create additional options for this field at <_TABNAME=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_CRMOTHERLIST_> > CRM Lists.

salesRep.externalId.description: References an employee record. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
salesRep.externalId.name: salesRep.externalId

salesRep.internalId.description: References an employee record. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
salesRep.internalId.name: salesRep.internalId

salesRep.name.description: References an employee record. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
salesRep.name.name: salesRep.name

salutation.description: Enter the title of this person, such as Mr., Mrs., Ms., Dr., Rev., etc.
salutation.name: salutation

sendEmail.description: If true, the customer is automatically sent an email notification when access to NetSuite is provided.
sendEmail.name: sendEmail

shipComplete.description: Check this box if you only want to ship orders to this customer when they are completely fulfilled.
shipComplete.name: shipComplete

shippingItem.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. This value sets the default shipping method for this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
shippingItem.externalId.name: shippingItem.externalId

shippingItem.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. This value sets the default shipping method for this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
shippingItem.internalId.name: shippingItem.internalId

shippingItem.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. This value sets the default shipping method for this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
shippingItem.name.name: shippingItem.name

sourceWebSite.externalId.description: This field is read-only. It shows the web site where the customer registered for a customer account.
sourceWebSite.externalId.name: sourceWebSite.externalId

sourceWebSite.internalId.description: This field is read-only. It shows the web site where the customer registered for a customer account.
sourceWebSite.internalId.name: sourceWebSite.internalId

sourceWebSite.name.description: This field is read-only. It shows the web site where the customer registered for a customer account.
sourceWebSite.name.name: sourceWebSite.name

startDate.description: Enter the date this person or company became a customer, lead or prospect.If this person or company has a contract with you, enter the start date of the contract.If you enter an estimate or an opportunity for this customer, this field will be updated with the date of that transaction.
startDate.name: startDate

subsidiary.externalId.description: Select the subsidiary to associate with this entity or job. You cannot enter transactions for this entity or job unless a subsidiary is assigned. If you select this entity on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The entity is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary. Note: Once a transaction has posted for the entity or job, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the entity or job record.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: Select the subsidiary to associate with this entity or job. You cannot enter transactions for this entity or job unless a subsidiary is assigned. If you select this entity on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The entity is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary. Note: Once a transaction has posted for the entity or job, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the entity or job record.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: Select the subsidiary to associate with this entity or job. You cannot enter transactions for this entity or job unless a subsidiary is assigned. If you select this entity on a transaction, the transaction is associated with this subsidiary. The entity is able to access only information associated with this subsidiary. Note: Once a transaction has posted for the entity or job, you are not able to change the subsidiary selected on the entity or job record.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

symbolPlacement.value.description: Select whether the symbol appears before or after the number.
symbolPlacement.value.name: symbolPlacement.value

syncPartnerTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update this customer's transactions to reflect the changes you make to the partner team.
syncPartnerTeams.name: syncPartnerTeams

taxItem.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Codes. This value provides the standard tax rate associated with this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
taxItem.externalId.name: taxItem.externalId

taxItem.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Codes. This value provides the standard tax rate associated with this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
taxItem.internalId.name: taxItem.internalId

taxItem.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Taxes > Tax Codes. This value provides the standard tax rate associated with this customer. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
taxItem.name.name: taxItem.name

taxable.description: True indicates that this customer pays sales tax according to the rate defined in the tax Item field. False indicates that this customer does not pay sales tax, but only if Tax Item field is empty.
taxable.name: taxable

terms.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Term. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
terms.externalId.name: terms.externalId

terms.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Term. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
terms.internalId.name: terms.internalId

terms.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > Term. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
terms.name.name: terms.name

territory.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Sales Management > Sales Territories. This value sets the sales territory this customer belongs in. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
territory.externalId.name: territory.externalId

territory.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Sales Management > Sales Territories. This value sets the sales territory this customer belongs in. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
territory.internalId.name: territory.internalId

territory.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Sales Management > Sales Territories. This value sets the sales territory this customer belongs in. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
territory.name.name: territory.name

thirdPartyAcct.description: Enter this customer’s FedEx® or UPS® account number in the 3rd Party Billing Account Number field.This account number is used if you select Consignee Billing on item fulfillments using UPS or select Bill Recipient on item fulfillments using FedEx.
thirdPartyAcct.name: thirdPartyAcct

thirdPartyCountry.value.description: Select the country associated with the customer’s UPS or FedEx account number.
thirdPartyCountry.value.name: thirdPartyCountry.value

thirdPartyZipcode.description: Enter the zip code associated with the customer’s UPS or FedEx account number.
thirdPartyZipcode.name: thirdPartyZipcode

title.description: Enter the job title for this person's position at his or her company.
title.name: title

type.value.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Sales Management > Sales Territories. This value sets the sales territory this customer belongs in. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation. For more information, see getSelectValue of the Platform Guide.
type.value.name: type.value

unbilledOrders.description: This field displays the total amount of orders that have been entered but not yet billed.If you have enabled the preference Customer Credit Limit Includes Orders, then this total is included in credit limit calculations.Set this preference at <_TABNAME=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=ADMI_ACCTSETUP_> > Set Up Accounting > General.If you use the Multiple Currencies feature, the amount in this field is shown in the customer's currency.
unbilledOrders.name: unbilledOrders

url.description: Sets the URL associated with the customer.
url.name: url

vatRegNumber.description: For the UK edition only. Note that this field is not validated when submitted via Web services.
vatRegNumber.name: vatRegNumber

visits.description: This field displays the total number of visits this customer has made to your Web site.A new visit is counted after the customer leaves your site and returns.
visits.name: visits

webLead.description: This is a read-only hidden field that defines whether a customer registered via a NetSuite website. It returns a string of either Yes or No.
webLead.name: webLead
